You can set the distance at which objects close to the camera are drawn. The default is 1

body: [bg storage="" time="" wait="" cross="" position="" method="" cond=""]
description: Switching is always performed on the fore layer.
Specify the image file name. Place the file in data/bgimage.
Specify the time it takes to switch backgrounds in milliseconds.
Whether to wait for the background to switch. Specify true or false. If you specify false, it will proceed to the next tag without waiting for the switch to be completed.

Specify true or false. The default is false. If you specify true, the two images will be switched at the same time while becoming transparent. If you specify false, the new background will be displayed by overlaying it on top of the old background. If you are using CG differences, it is recommended to use false.

If omitted, the image will be stretched to fill the game screen (the ratio will be lost). If you specify this value, you can place the background without losing the ratio if the ratio of the background image and the screen size is different. Select the placement position from the following keywords: left (left-justified), center (center-justified), right (right-justified), top (top-justified), bottom (bottom-justified)
Specifies the type of transition. The default is fadeIn. The following effects can be specified.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [bgmopt volume="" buf="" effect="" time="" tag_volume="" samebgm_restart="" cond=""]
description: You can change the BGM settings.
You can specify the BGM config volume from 0 to 100.
You can specify the slot for which you want to change the settings. If omitted, the common volume for all slots will be set.
Whether to immediately reflect the change in config volume to the currently playing BGM. Specify true or false.
You can specify the fade time in milliseconds when the volume change is immediately reflected.

You can specify 0 to 100 to change the tag volume of the currently playing BGM. The tag volume is the volume specified in the [playbgm] tag. For example, this function can be used to change the volume of a BGM that originally started playing with [playbgm volume="50"] to [playbgm This can be used in cases where you want to correct the volume to the volume that would have been played if it had been set to [volume="100"]. Simply specifying this will not change the config volume. Specifying this will force effect to true.
You can set the action to take if the BGM you are trying to play with the [playbgm] tag is already playing. If it is true, it will restart from the beginning, if it is false, it will be ignored.

description: You can customize the game screen size and the black bars around the outside of the game screen. You can change the color of the black bars, set an image for the black bars, and change the game screen size during the game.
Specifies the image to be set as the background outside the game screen. Place it in the bgimage folder.
Specifies the display pattern when an image is specified for the background. The default is to display it repeatedly vertically and horizontally.
round (repeats the entire screen, breaking the ratio)
Specifies the background color in 0xRRGGBB format. Ignored if bgimage is set.
Whether to stretch the background image to fill the entire screen. Specify with true or false.
You can change the original width of the game screen during the game. This tag is designed for responsive play. It corresponds to scWidth in Config.tjs.
You can change the original height of the game screen during the game. This tag is designed for responsive play. It corresponds to scHeight in Config.tjs.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
[Discards the hibernation state saved with the [sleepgame] tag.

body: [button graphic="" folder="" storage="" target="" name="" x="" y="" width="" height="" fix="" role="" exp="" preexp="" hint="" clickse="" enterse="" leavese="" activeimg="" clickimg="" enterimg="" autoimg="" skipimg="" visible="" auto_next="" savesnap="" keyfocus="" cond=""]
description: Displays a graphical button. It is the image version of the [link] tag.
Specifies the image to be used as the button. The file is placed in the data/image folder.

You can specify the folder containing the image. By default, images for the foreground layer are in the fgimage folder, and images for the background layer are in the bgimage folder, but this can be changed.
Specifies the name of the scenario file to jump to. If omitted, the current scenario file is assumed.
Specifies the label name to jump to. If omitted, it will jump to the beginning of the scenario file.

This name can be animated using the [anim] tag, etc. Multiple names can be specified by separating them with commas. (Advanced knowledge: The value specified in the name attribute becomes the HTML class attribute.)
Specifies the horizontal position of the button
Specifies the vertical position of the button.
You can specify the width of the button in pixels.
You can specify the height of the button in pixels.

Whether to make it a fixed button (a button that is always displayed, such as a save button). Specify true or false. Normal choice buttons are false (default). Unlike choice buttons, fixed buttons can be clicked on the screen while they are displayed to continue reading the scenario normally.
If you specify true, the button will be placed on a special layer called the fix layer. To remove elements added to the fix layer, use the [clearfix] tag.
If you specify true for fix, you must specify a different storage target and write the processing to be performed when the button is pressed there.
If you specify true for fix, a call stack will remain. Please note that the button will not be enabled until the call stack is cleared.

You can assign a special function to the button. In this case, storage and target will be ignored. Also, the fix attribute will be forcibly set to true. The keywords that can be specified are as follows.
You can specify the JS to be executed when the button is clicked.
When the tag is executed, the value specified in this attribute will be stored in the variable preexp. Then, when the button is clicked, the variable preexp will become available in exp.
You can specify the text of the tooltip that will be displayed when the mouse cursor is paused over the button.
You can set the sound effect to be played when the button is clicked. Place the sound effect file in the sound folder.
You can set the sound effect to be played when the mouse cursor is placed over the button. Place the sound effect file in the sound folder.
You can set the sound effect to be played when the mouse cursor is removed from the button. Place the sound effect file in the sound folder.
You can specify the image file to be switched while the mouse button is pressed over the button. Place the file in the image folder.
You can specify the image file to be switched after the button is clicked. Place the file in the image folder.
You can specify an image file to switch to when the mouse cursor hovers over the button. Place the file in the image folder.
You can specify an image file to switch to when auto mode is started. Place the file in the image folder.
You can specify an image file to switch to when skip mode is started. Place the file in the image folder.
Whether to display the button from the beginning. True displays it, false hides it.
Specify true or false. If false is specified here and fix=true, the button will not advance to the next tag when you return with [return].
Specify true or false. If true, the save snap at the time this button is pressed will be secured. If you want to move to the save screen, set this to true, save, and then execute save.

If you specify false, you will not be able to select the buttons with a keyboard or gamepad. If you specify a number such as 1 or 2, you can specify the order in which buttons are selected with the focus_next action in the key configuration.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
Jumps to the specified scenario file label.
Specify the scenario file containing the subroutine you want to call. If omitted, it is assumed to be in the current scenario file.
Specify the label of the subroutine you want to call. If omitted, it will be executed from the beginning of the file.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [camera time="" x="" y="" zoom="" rotate="" from_x="" from_y="" from_zoom="" from_rotate="" wait="" layer="" ease_type="" cond=""]
description: You can create effects such as zooming and panning the camera.
Using the camera function allows you to create a variety of effects, such as focusing on the facial expression of a character standing image or zooming in on various parts of a single image.
Specifies the time in milliseconds for the camera to move to the coordinates.
Specifies the X coordinate to move the camera to.
Specifies the Y coordinate to move the camera to.
Specifies the camera magnification. Specifying 2 will result in a 2x zoom.
Specifies the camera tilt. Specifying 20 will tilt the camera 20 degrees.
You can specify the X coordinate at which the camera starts to move.
You can specify the Y coordinate at which the camera starts to move.
You can specify the magnification at which the camera starts to move.
You can specify the tilt at which the camera starts to move.
Specify whether to wait for the camera movement to complete with true or false. If you specify false, the game can proceed even while the camera is moving.

Specifies the layer to which the camera effect will be applied. For background, use base. For foreground layers, use a number greater than 0. By specifying this, you can limit the effect of the camera to a specific layer. Normally, it affects all layers.
You can specify the camera movement direction.
ease (plays smoothly from the start to the end point)
ease-in (plays slowly from the start point)
ease-out (plays slowly from the end point)
ease-in-out (plays slowly from the start to the end point)
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
Turns off skip mode. Same as [skipstop].
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
You can change the volume of the audio currently being played.
To change the volume of the background music, specify "bgm". To change the volume of the sound effects, specify "se".
You can specify the slot to change the settings for. If omitted, the process will be performed on the audio of all slots.
You can specify the fade time in milliseconds.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [chara_config pos_mode="" ptext="" time="" memory="" anim="" pos_change_time="" talk_focus="" brightness_value="" blur_value="" talk_anim="" talk_anim_time="" talk_anim_value="" talk_anim_zoom_rate="" effect="" cond=""]
description: You can change the basic settings of the character control tag.
Specify true or false. The default is true. If true, the character's position will be automatically calculated and placed when displayed with the [chara_show] tag.

Specify the crossfade time in milliseconds when changing facial expressions with the [chara_mod] tag. Specifying 0 will switch instantly.

Whether to remember the facial expression when the character is removed. Specify true or false. If true, the character will be displayed with the facial expression from the last time they were removed when they are reintroduced.
If automatic character placement is enabled with pos_mode=true, whether to animate the change in character position. Specify true or false.
Specifies the animation time in milliseconds when automatically adjusting the character's position.
This setting enables the effect of making the currently speaking character's standing portrait stand out. The following keywords can be specified: brightness, blur, none
To specify who is currently speaking, use the [chara_ptext] tag or its abbreviation, such as #akane.
When talk_focus=brightness, specifies the brightness of non-speaking characters from 0 to 100. The default is 60. In other words, non-speaking characters are slightly darkened.
When talk_focus=blur, specifies the blur level of non-speaking characters. The default is 2. The higher the value, the stronger the blur.

This setting automatically adds a bouncing animation to the character's standing portrait when the character begins to speak. The following keywords can be specified: up (bounce up), down (sink down), zoom (zoom in), none (disabled)
When talk_anim is enabled, specifies the animation time in milliseconds.
When talk_anim is enabled, specifies the amount of character movement (pixels).
Specifies the magnification rate when using zoom with talk_anim. Default is 1.2

You can specify the effect (movement) when characters switch positions. The keywords that can be specified are as follows:

Specify the name attribute defined in [chara_new].

body: [chara_hide name="" time="" wait="" layer="" pos_mode="" cond=""]
description: Causes the character displayed with the [chara_show] tag to exit.
Specify the name attribute defined in [chara_new].

Whether to wait for the fade-out to complete. Specify with true or false.
The layer to be deleted. If a layer was specified with [chara_show], specify it here as well.

body: [chara_layer name="" part="" id="" storage="" zindex="" cond=""]
description: Define the difference part for the character's facial expression.
The default part will be the first part registered.
The name of the character registering the part. Specify the name attribute defined in [chara_new].
Specify the name to register as a part. For example, you can register a part called eyes, and register any number of other differences within this part.
Specify the name to identify the difference within the part. For example, within the part called eyes, you can register IDs for smiling eyes and crying eyes.
Specify the image to register as the difference. Place the image in the data/fgimage folder. Specifying none will cause the part to not exist by default.

Specify the priority with a number to determine which part will be displayed in front when this part overlaps with another part. The higher the number, the more it will be displayed in front. Once registered, it will also be applied to other differences of the same part.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
You can change the settings defined in the [chara_layer] tag.
The name of the character whose part definition you want to change. Specify the name attribute defined in [chara_new].
Specify the part name you want to change.

Specify the priority number to determine which part will be displayed in front when this part overlaps with another part. The higher the number, the more it will be displayed in front. This setting will not be reflected immediately. It will be reflected the next time it is displayed.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [chara_mod name="" face="" time="" storage="" reflect="" wait="" cross="" cond=""]
description: Changes the character image. Can be used to change facial expressions.
Specify the crossfade time in milliseconds when changing facial expressions with the [chara_mod] tag. Specifying 0 will switch instantly.
Specify the image file to change. Image files are placed in the data/fgimage folder.
Whether to mirror the image horizontally. Specify true or false. Specify true to display the image mirrored.
Whether to wait for the crossfade of facial expression changes to finish. Specify true or false.

Specify the crossfade method as true or false. If you specify true, the old image will fade out and the new image will fade in at the same time. If you specify false, the old image will remain and the new image will fade in on top of it.

If you specify true, the character may become slightly transparent at the moment of crossfade, allowing the background to be seen. In such cases, you can change the expression without making the character transparent by specifying false. However, although the character will no longer be transparent, if the expression change changes the silhouette, it may look unnatural.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

If you want to display this character in the namespace, you can specify the name to apply. For example, if you specify #yuko, it will be displayed as Yuko in the message area.

This tag is used to display the character's name. The main use will be to display the name of the currently speaking character at the top of the message window. By specifying the face attribute, you can change the character's facial expression at the same time as displaying the name.

body: [fadeinbgm storage="" loop="" sprite_time="" time="" volume="" html5="" pause="" seek="" cond=""]
description: Specify the music file to play.
Whether to loop. Specify with true or false.

You can specify the section to play. Specify the start and end times in milliseconds, connected with a hyphen. For example, if you specify 6000-10000, it will play 4 seconds from 00:06 to 00:10. If the loop attribute is true, it will loop playback during this period.
V515 and later: You can now specify minutes:seconds as in 00:06-00:10. Be sure to include the :.
Specify the fade-in time in milliseconds.
You can specify the volume to play. Specify a value between 0 and 100.
Normally, you do not need to specify this. If you are using HTML5 Audio, specify true. If you are using Web Audio, specify true. If you use the API, set it to false (default).
If you set it to true, BGM will not play when the tag is executed. You can play it with [resumebgm]
You can set the playback start time. For example, if you set it to 4.5, the BGM will start playing 4.5 seconds ahead

Specifies the horizontal alignment of the button from left (left alignment), center (center alignment), or right (right alignment).
Specifying wrap enables wrapping when the button does not fit in the area.

You can specify the position and size of the area that will be the basis for alignment. Specifying auto (default) will automatically adjust the area taking into account the message window. Specifying cover will use the entire screen as the basis. If you want to specify the position and size of the area directly, specify four numbers separated by commas, such as 100,100,1000,1000. This will be interpreted as left, top, width, height, respectively.
Specifies the time for the display animation in milliseconds. Specifying 0 will not animate. Note that the button cannot be clicked during animation.
You can specify the effect of the display animation using the following keywords.
You can specify the name of the keyframe animation defined in the [keyframe] tag as the display animation. If you specify this, show_effect will be ignored.

You can specify the delay in milliseconds when displaying each button. If you specify 0, all buttons will be displayed at the same time. For example, if you specify 100, each button will be displayed one at a time every 100 milliseconds.
You can specify the change pattern of the display animation. You can specify the following keywords. The default is linear.
ease (plays the start and end points smoothly)
ease-in-out (plays the start and end points slowly)
You can also specify your own easing using the cubic-bezier function.
Specifies the time in milliseconds for the exit animation when a button is selected. If you specify 0, no animation will be performed.
The following keywords can be used to specify the effect of the exit animation when selected.
You can specify the name of the keyframe animation defined in the [keyframe] tag as the exit animation when a button is selected. If you specify this, select_effect will be ignored.
Specifies the delay in milliseconds before the exit animation starts when a button is selected.
Specifies the easing of the exit animation when a button is selected.
Specifies the time in milliseconds for the exit animation when a button is not selected. Specifying 0 will disable the animation.
You can specify the effect of the exit animation when a button is not selected with the following keywords.
You can specify the name of the keyframe animation defined in the [keyframe] tag as the exit animation when not selected. If you specify this, reject_effect will be ignored.
Specifies the delay in milliseconds before starting the exit animation when selected.
Specifies the easing of the exit animation when selected.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [message_config ch_speed_in_click="" effect_speed_in_click="" edge_overlap_text="" speech_bracket_float="" speech_margin_left="" kerning="" add_word_nobreak="" remove_word_nobreak="" line_spacing="" letter_spacing="" control_line_break="" control_line_break_chars="" cond=""]
description: You can configure detailed settings related to messages.
The settings of omitted attributes will not be changed.
Character display speed after a click while displaying characters. Specify the display time per character in milliseconds.
If you specify default, the character display speed before the click will be inherited.
Character effect speed after a click while displaying characters. Specify 0.2s, 200ms, or simply 200. All examples are 200 milliseconds.
If you specify default, the character display speed before the click will be inherited.
Whether to overlap the edge of the border text with the previous character. Specify true or false. Currently, this parameter is only valid when edge_method is set to stroke.

This setting floats the opening bracket of a character's dialogue to the left, preventing text from wrapping around under the opening bracket. If you set this to true, only the opening bracket will shift to the left. If you set this to false, it will be disabled. By specifying a number such as 20 instead of true, you can directly specify the amount to shift the opening bracket to the left.

When speech_bracket_float is enabled, you can move the entire text further to the right. If you set this to true, it will be enabled, and if you set this to false, it will be disabled. By specifying a number such as 20, you can directly specify the amount to shift the entire text to the right.

Enable character spacing. Specify true or false. Depending on the font, original character spacing settings, and the browser used by the player, the effect may not be seen. (Advanced knowledge: This is a function that sets the CSS font-feature-settings property.)
You can add words that prohibit word breaking (the phenomenon where a line break occurs naturally in the middle of a word). Multiple words can be specified by separating them with commas.
You can remove prohibited word breaking words that have already been added. Multiple words can be specified by separating them with commas.
You can specify the line spacing size in px units.
You can specify the letter spacing size in px units.

Specify whether to perform line break processing manually with true or false. When certain characters such as 。 and 。 are at the beginning of a line, the line break will be performed at the character before it. Basically, line break processing will be performed automatically even if this is not specified, but depending on the font settings (effects, borders, etc.), line break processing may not be performed automatically. In that case, try specifying true for this parameter.
Specifies a group of characters that will be treated as line breaks when they are at the beginning of a line. By default, 。 and 。 are the characters that are subject to line break processing.

body: [playbgm storage="" loop="" sprite_time="" volume="" html5="" pause="" seek="" restart="" cond=""]

Whether to loop. Specify with true or false.

V515 and later: You can now specify minutes:seconds as in 00:06-00:10. Be sure to include the :.
You can specify the volume to be played. Specify a value between 0 and 100.
Normally, you do not need to specify this. If you are using HTML5 Audio, specify true. If you are using Web Audio API, specify false (default).

Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.

body: [position layer="" page="" left="" top="" width="" height="" frame="" color="" border_color="" border_size="" opacity="" marginl="" margint="" marginr="" marginb="" margin="" radius="" vertical="" visible="" gradient="" cond=""]
description: Specifies various attributes for the message window.
If any of the attributes are omitted, the settings will not be changed.
Specifies whether the target is the front page or back page of the layer. Specify with fore or back. If omitted, the front page is assumed.
Specifies the left position of the message window. (pixels)
Specifies the top position of the message window. (pixels)
Specifies the width of the message window. (pixels)
Specifies the height of the message window. (pixels)
Specifies the image to be displayed as the frame image of the message window.
Adjust the image size according to the width and height attributes. Use the margin attribute to adjust the area where the message is actually displayed.
You can also return to the standard frame by specifying none.
Specifies the display color of the message window in 0xRRGGBB format.
Specify the color of the border when it is enabled in 0xRRGGBB format. The border_size attribute must also be specified
Specifies the thickness of the border when it is enabled. If you specify 0, the border will not be displayed. The default value is 0.
Specifies the opacity of the message window with a value between 0 and 255. 0 is completely transparent (this is not the opacity of the text or the layer itself).
Specifies the left margin of the message window.
Specifies the top margin of the message window.
Specifies the right margin of the message window.
Specifies the bottom margin of the message window.
Specifies the margins of the message window all at once. For example, if you specify 30, a margin of 30px will be created on all four sides.

You can also specify the margins for each direction at once by separating them with commas. You can specify them as follows: top/bottom, left/right, top/left/right, bottom, top/right/bottom, left (change the direction part to a number).
Specify the roundness of the message window corners with a numerical value. Example: 10 (modest rounded corners), 30 (normal rounded corners), 100 (huge rounded corners)
Whether to put the message window in vertical writing mode. Specify true or false. True for vertical writing, false for horizontal writing.
Whether to make the message layer visible. Specifying true or false allows you to control the visibility of the message layer at the same time.
You can apply a gradient to the background. It is specified in CSS gradient format. For example, CSS gradients are in the format of linear-gradient(45deg, red 0%, yellow 100%).
There are several sites on the web that allow you to easily create CSS gradients, so try searching for CSS gradient generator.
Write a JS expression and the tag will be executed only if the result is true.
; Change the position and size of the message window
; Change the color and transparency of the message window

body: [position_filter layer="" page="" remove="" grayscale="" sepia="" saturate="" hue="" invert="" opacity="" brightness="" contrast="" blur="" cond=""]
description: You can apply a filter effect to the back of the message window.
This allows you to make the message window look like frosted glass, for example.
Specifies whether the front or back page of the layer is the target. Specify with fore or back. If omitted, the front page is assumed.
True or false. Specifying true will remove the filter.
You can convert the image display to grayscale by specifying a value between 0 (default) and 100.
You can convert the image display to sepia by specifying a value between 0 (default) and 100.
You can change the saturation (color vividness) of the image display by specifying a value between 0 and 100 (default).
You can change the hue of the image display by specifying a value between 0 (default) and 360.
By specifying a value between 0 (default) and 100, you can invert the gradation of the image display.
You can change the transparency of the image display by specifying a value between 0 and 100 (default).
You can change the brightness of the image by specifying a value based on 100 (default). 0 is pitch black, and values ​​above 100 make it brighter.
You can change the contrast of the image display by specifying a value between 0 and 100 (default).
You can blur the image display by specifying a value between 0 (default) and any other value.

If you specify true, the game will stop until all loading is complete. If you specify true, you should display Now Loading or something similar on the screen to let the player know that the materials are loading.

This parameter is only meaningful when loading audio files. If you specify true (default), the preload data will be disposable and will be discarded once it has been used with [playbgm], etc. (to avoid memory pressure). If you want to keep the preload data after using it once, specify false. Even if you specify false, you can explicitly discard the preload data by using the [unload] tag.

This parameter is only meaningful when loading audio files. For example, by giving group names such as "bgm", "se", and "section1", you can specify the targets collectively when discarding data later with the [unload] tag. Multiple specifications are possible, separated by commas.

body: [ptext layer="" page="" text="" x="" y="" vertical="" size="" face="" color="" bold="" edge="" shadow="" name="" width="" align="" time="" overwrite="" gradient="" cond=""]
description: Displays text in the foreground layer. Can be used when you want to display text on the screen separately from the text in the message window.
Specify the foreground layer to target with an integer of 0 or greater.
Whether to target the front or back page of the layer. Specify with fore or back. If omitted, the front page is assumed.
Content of the text to display.
Specifies the left edge position of the text. (pixels)
Specifies the top edge position of the text. (pixels)
Whether to write vertically. Specify with true or false.
Specifies the font size in pixels.
Specifies the font type. Non-KAG compatible, but web fonts can also be used.
Specify the font color in 0xRRGGBB format.
Specify bold to make the text bold. (Set this parameter to CSS font-style.)
V515 and later: You can now also set it to bold with true.
You can enable text borders. Specify the text color to be bordered in 0xRRGGBB format.

V515 and later: You can also specify the border thickness. Enter the border thickness in px before the color, for example, 4px 0xFF0000. Separate the thickness and color with a half-width space. You can also specify multiple borders separated by commas, for example, 4px 0xFF0000, 2px 0xFFFFFF.
Adds a shadow to the text. Specify the shadow color in 0xRRGGBB format. Disabled if a border is being used.

You can animate this name from the [anim] tag, etc. Multiple names can be specified by separating them with commas. (Advanced knowledge: The value specified in the name attribute becomes the HTML class attribute.)
Specifies the width of the text display area in pixels.
You can specify the horizontal position of the text. The widthparameter must be specified at the same time. left (left-justified), center (center-justified), right (right-justified)
Specify the fade-in time in milliseconds. If you specify this, the image will gradually appear from a transparent state. If you omit it, it will be displayed instantly.
Specify whether to overwrite with true or false. If you specify true, if text with the same name already exists, the existing text will be overwritten instead of new text being added.
V515 and later: You can apply a gradient to text. Specify a CSS gradient function. A gradient function is a string such as linear-gradient(45deg, red 0%, yellow 100%).
There are several sites on the Web that allow you to easily create gradient functions, so try searching for CSS gradient generator.
